abstract: Westchester County police face criticism, and possible legal action, after making public the names of 16 men it says engaged in unlawful sexual activity in Saxon Woods county park in White Plains, even though men pleaded guilty to lesser charge of disorderly conduct and their cases were supposed to have been sealed.
snippet: An effort by the Westchester County police to create a fear of being publicly shamed has prompted criticism.
lead_paragraph: An effort by the Westchester County police to create a fear of being publicly shamed has prompted criticism.

headline.main: After Arrests in Park Known for Sex, Cases Are Sealed, but Names Are Released
headline.print_headline: After Arrests in Park Known for Sex, Cases Are Sealed, but Names Are Made Public
headline.seo: Names Released in Sealed Cases in Westchester Park Known for Sex
